intro: Sherbournia hapalophylla subsp. hapalophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leafed rockheath, is a small, herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions. The plant features narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its flowers are small and clustered, usually in pale green or yellowish inflorescences. It is adapted to arid conditions and is considered a rare and specialized species within its habitat.
